item.title: Youtube Video Reviewer - Upwork
item.description:
I'm looking for someone to review YouTube videos that were created by my team of freelancers. Each video is around 25 - 35 minutes.

The price per 10 videos reviewed: $30 ($3 per video)
How many videos per week: 21

What you will be doing:
- Finding clear mistakes in the videos (pronunciation, wrong facts etc.)
- Suggest improvements on making the content more engaging (transitions, better footage, overlays, split screens, ...)
- Making sure that the videos follow YouTube's terms of service
- To review each video you will record a loom video while reviewing, and sharing your feedback. After which you can write down the feedback (usually bullet points) and send it back to the team

It is absolutely mandatory that this person has:
1) Decent common knowledge to be able to catch mistakes ( quiet audio, to loud sound effects, spelling errors, copyright violations etc.)
2) Experience with video editing software to know what is possible and what isn't.
3) Are available for a call (for the explanation)

Type of videos you will be reviewing:
https://www.youtube.com/@TheUltimateExpeditionOfficial

If you want to increase the chance of being hired, review a few minutes of one of the videos and include it in your proposal. I look forward to working with you.

Budget: $30

item.title: Video Editor for Explainer-Style Science and Documentary Videos - Upwork
item.description:
We are seeking a skilled and creative Video Editor to join our team for an ongoing project.

The ideal candidate should have experience in creating high-quality explainer-style videos, with a strong preference for those who have worked on science and documentary projects.

Responsibilities:

Edit video content to create engaging and informative explainer videos.

Collaborate with our team to understand the project requirements and deliver videos that meet our vision.
Ensure the final product is polished, professional, and ready for publication.

Incorporate feedback and make revisions as necessary.
Requirements:

Proven experience as a Video Editor, specifically with explainer-style videos.
Preferably, experience working on science and documentary projects.

Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar.
Strong storytelling skills and an eye for detail.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications:

A portfolio showcasing your previous work on explainer videos, science content, or documentaries.
Experience with motion graphics and animation is a plus.
Familiarity with sound editing and color correction.


How to Apply:

Please submit your application including:

A brief introduction about yourself and your experience.
Links to your portfolio or examples of your previous work.
Your availability and expected rate.

We look forward to seeing your applications and potentially working together to create some amazing content!

About Us:

We are a passionate team dedicated to producing educational and engaging video content. Our projects span various topics, but we have a special focus on science and documentary-style storytelling. Join us in our mission to educate and inspire through visual media!
